reviews.title: Your Choice Not Mine
reviews.review_text: Tried to set it up under 2 dirfferent computers one wouldnt recognize it and the other didnt think it was ghonna hook up, plus the sound quailty is not very good,

reviews.title: Not worth the discount
reviews.review_text: This monitor appears nice on the outside, as it is asthetically pleasing, however, once you get on the inside, nothing but disappointment lurks. This is one of those times where the old saying "you get what you pay for" comes into play. There is one, and only one, button on this whole screen and it is a toggle like a joystick that you would find on a game controller. Using this toggle is clunky and awkward, especially with your arm around the screen. Toggling through available selections and selecting something to change is a nightmare all in it's own. This wouldn't be such a big deal if I was only using one input but I often switch between the two and the functionality just ins't there. It's stupid, to say the least. My favorite part is that sometimes when switching between inputs, nothing happens, and you have to unplug the cable you're not trying to use. Lucikly my desk is set up in a way that I can get to the back of it easily, but I shouldn't have to. Aside from input control, the on screen text leaves something to be disired - the font looks...pixelated? I don't know how to explain it other than to say it is NOT clear. If it wasn't for the size of the screen, I would have trouble reading. I have not used this monitor for gaming, so I can't speak to that, but I have used it for streaming which is just o.k. The blacks aren't very deep and the colors are so so. I am using this as a second monitor to a Dell laptop and the Dell is crystal clear for comparison. Overall, this just wasn't a good purchase, and you can order the same monitor from Temu, if that tells you anything.

reviews.title: Beware if trying to mount it!
reviews.review_text: Decent monitor for the price. It's VESA 75x75, but almost all VESA mounts are dual 75/100, and the 100 is too large to fit in the recessed round back. Very poor design. They could have at least provided an adapter to be able to mount it.

reviews.title: Can u hear me now
reviews.review_text: the sound is terrible i contacted the seller sent them a videos of the sound they had the nerve to say they it has sound i had it on 100 it sounded like it was on 3 . dont waste your money with this company they dont stand behind their product

reviews.title: Totally upset!!
reviews.review_text: NEVER got product because shipping service shipped my product to the wrong address. Customer service representative said they would send out another one within 24-48 hours, but I have not received that replacement product either.

i bought the monitor for Christmas fornmy step son, and it didnt even last 3 months, startwd flickering and wont even turn on now, called the seller and they told me it onyl had a 30 day warranty, just wow 30 day's, contacted Walmart cuatomer support and they will not help either, so basically just scammed out of 126$.. Never again buying from seller or Walmart...

reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!
reviews.review_text: Can't even give a proper review, because it didn't even work currently. No audio and for some reason, it refused to go full screen, even though settings was set correctly on both ends, it felt like a scam. I would stay as far away from this company as possible. I don't understand why Walmart deals with companies like this, it's been over a week and still haven't received my refund, because of Ordering Online. It can take up to two weeks to receive your refund so save the inconvenience and choose a different monitor.

i didnt read the reviews before I purchased first off. When the package got here everything was fine. I go to hook it up to my ps5 its starts glitching. I wouldn't recommend. Lowkey scamming should have just ordered off amazon. Sincerely your favorite yn.

reviews.title: Zero customer service
reviews.review_text: Bought this in October and this month the monitor died. It was past Walmarts warranty period so I emailed gawfolk. I then went to their website and requested help on three separate occasions. At this point, three weeks later, I haven't received a call, text, email or anything. I assume their goal is to provide zero help and I'll go away…so I will and I'll just chalk up the lost money but I will never ever buy another Gawfolk product if this is how they treat their customers.

reviews.title: TERRIBLE MONITOR - NOT MADE FOR GAMING
reviews.review_text: Worst monitor I have brought definately not a gaming monitor. Colors arent crisp. They are trying to unload these subpar monitors. 100% not a gaming monitor!!!

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.review_text: The picture quality was not good. The screen looked washed out and pixelated. I have a gaming system with a very high end video card so that wasn't the issue. I end up purchasing a 32” LG computer monitor for about the same price and the picture quality is phenomenal!

reviews.title: Monitor doesn't work, and company refuses top hono
reviews.review_text: Monitor worked for 1 hour before turning off and back on. Then it had other issues such as the DP1 or DP2 logo when never go off the screen. The monitor would go blank after 1-2 min and would need to unplug for 5 min before it would work again. The power button and OSD buttons would not work unless unplugged for a few min. All these issues kept reoccuring within a few min of plugging it in. Tried to contact the company 5 times to have it fixed under warranty. They never responded.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review_text: i have not had much of a problem with deliveries from Walmart. When delivered by FedEx, there tend to be issues. This was to be left at the front door but was left on a picnic table in the front yard. They have no regard for their deliveries. If I order online and see FedEx, I will most likely look elsewhere for item.
